CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 8, 1944, pg. 10 reads: "Stanton-Taylor Wedding Party - Principals in Stanton-Taylor wedding party in Pittsburgh Saturday, July 1. Left to right include the bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. John Stanton; bridesmaids, Miss Alice Batch, D.C.; Mrs .Jean Nelson Harvey, Philly; Miss Eva Stanton, sister, who was maid of honor; the bride and groom, Mr. and Mrs. Edward V. Taylor; matrons of honor, Mrs. Romaine Denning Lyons and Mrs. Elsie Stanton Cobb of Detroit; bridesmaids, Mrs. Helen Douglass Bolden and Miss Betty Brady.  Mrs. R.R. Taylor, Sr., mother of the groom is at the extreme right.  Ushers were P.L. Prattis, Robert R. Taylor, brother of the groom and best man; Dr. Joseph Robinson of Albany, N.Y.; Samuel Milai and Atty. Wendell Stanton of Pittsburgh. - Courier Photo by Harris."   Portions of accompanying article read: "Stanton-Taylor Marriage Unites Prominent Families, Pittsburgh, Pa. - In a ceremony that embodied beauty, solemnity and charming simplicity, Miss Marian Stanton, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. John Stanton of Pittsburgh became the bride of Edward Victor Taylor, son of the late Robert R. Taylor, Sr., and Mrs. Taylor of Wilmington, N. C., Saturday, July 1 at Holy Cross Episcopal Church with Father Charles Levy officiating.  The bride, given in marriage by her father, wore a white satin gown with sweetheart neckline and a tulle veil attached to a coronet of lace.  Her bouquet was of white roses and orchids.  Attendants, all of whom wore white, were her sisters and close friends, including her sister Eva as maid of honor; sister Mrs. Elsie Stanton Cobb of Detroit, Mrs. Romaine Denning Lyons matrons of honor, and Miss Betty Brady, Mrs. Helen Douglass Bolden, Miss Alice Batch, of D. C., and Mrs. Jean Nelson Harvey of Philadelphia are bridesmaids.  Brother is best man.  The groom's brother, Robert R. Taylor of Chicago was best man.  Ushers included Dr. Joseph Robinson of Albany, N.Y.; P. L. Prattis, Wendell Stanton and Samuel Milai of Pittsburgh.  Tiny Patricia Prattis was flower girl... The bride is a graduate of the University of Pittsburgh and until her marriage, was a teacher in the Pittsburgh School system.  She is a member of AKA, the Debs About Town and the We'Uns.  The groom, who is a regional director of the Federal Social Security board in the East, is the son of the late vice-president and superintendent of industry of Tuskegee.  He has attended Tuskegee, Fisk (where he received his B.S.) the University of Chicago and Columbia..."
TitMainTitle: Full length group portrait of Stanton -Taylor wedding party, from left, first row: Alice Batch, Jean Nelson Harvey, Eva Stanton, bride Marian Stanton Taylor, groom Edward Victor Taylor, Romaine Denning Lyons, Elsie Stanton Cobb, Helen Douglass Bolden, and Betty Brady; second row: P.L. Prattis, Robert R. Taylor, Dr. Joseph Robinson, Samuel Milai, and Atty. Wendell Stanton, posed in grass with building in background, possibly home of Mr. and Mrs. John Stanton
